universal_input.title: üì• How to Load Files/URLs

3Ô∏è‚É£ BROWSE BUTTON
   ‚Ä¢ 'Open Explorer' - Opens File Explorer

LOADING MULTIPLE FILES OR URLs:

FROM DOCUMENTS LIBRARY:

SUPPORTED CONTENT:

load_button.title: ‚ñ∂ Load
load_button.description:
Extract or transcribe text from the selected file or URL.

Text that is loaded is saved to the Documents Library.

bulk_button.title: üì¶ Bulk Import
bulk_button.description:
Import multiple files and/or URLs into the Documents Library at the same time.

From there, use the 'Add Files' button below to select them (as well as other items in the Documents Library) so that they can be analysed as a group.

Possible applications include obtaining consolidated summaries, compare-and-contrast analyses or gap analyses.

There may be limits on your ability to do group analyses using local AI. For further information, consult the Local AI Guide, which can be accessed via the Help menu located in the top left corner. You can get an assessment of your computer's ability to use local AI by clicking the 'Settings' button below and then selecting 'System Check'.

force_reocr_button.title: üîÑ Force Re-OCR
force_reocr_button.description: Reprocess the current PDF with OCR (Optical Character Recognition). Use this if the initial text extraction missed content or if you've changed OCR settings to get a better result.

ocr_settings_button.title: ‚öôÔ∏è OCR Settings
ocr_settings_button.description:
Configure how scanned PDFs are processed. Adjust language and quality settings.

Higher quality settings are slower more accurate.

Use 'Test OCR' to verify your setup works.

transcribe_audio_button.title: üé§ Transcribe Audio
transcribe_audio_button.description:
Convert audio or video files to text using speech-to-text. Supports MP3, WAV, M4A, MP4, and other formats.

Choose your transcription engine in Audio Settings.

Faster-whisper runs locally and is free. The first transaction will be slower as the program is downloaded on first use and it is a big file.

You will need an API key if you select OpenAI Whisper or AssemblyAI. It is fast, accurate and has a small usage charge.

You can access TurboScribe - an excellent online transcription service with a generous 'free' service tier - by selecting the separate 'Send to TurboScribe' button.

audio_settings_button.title: ‚öôÔ∏è Audio Settings
audio_settings_button.description:
Configure audio transcription options including engine selection, language, speaker identification, and model quality.

Language will be auto-detected if you do not specify a language.

Speaker diarization identifies who's speaking. It's available in the cloud through TurboScribe and AssemblyAI, but not locally through Faster-Whisper.

bypass_cache_checkbox.title: ‚òëÔ∏è Bypass Cache
bypass_cache_checkbox.description:
When checked, forces re-transcription even if this audio has been processed before. Normally, cached transcripts are reused, which is much faster than repeatedly transcribing.

Use this if you are changing transcription settings in search of a better quality result.

send_turboscribe_button.title: üöÄ Send to TurboScribe
send_turboscribe_button.description:
Open TurboScribe's website where you can upload audio files for transcription. After transcription, use 'Import Transcript' to bring back the transcribed text.

TurboScribe is an excellent service offering free transcriptions within limits. Account required.

import_turboscribe_button.title: üì• Import Transcript
import_turboscribe_button.description:
Import transcribed text from TurboScribe.

TurboScribe can export transcribed text as TXT, DOCX, PDF, SRT, VTT, or CSV. If you want the transcribed text to be stored in the Documents Library, export it as TXT or in a subtitle format (SRT or VTT).

download_video_button.title: üì• Download Video
download_video_button.description:
Download the YouTube video file to your computer. Useful for offline viewing or extracting audio for transcription.

The downloads are saved to your default Downloads folder.

Not implemented yet - will feature in next version.

yt_fallback_checkbox.title: ‚òëÔ∏è Audio Fallback
yt_fallback_checkbox.description:
When checked, if no official transcript is available, the app will download the audio and transcribe it using speech-to-text.

Useful for videos without subtitles.

Uses your selected transcription engine.

May incur API costs if using OpenAI Whisper.

reload_document_button.title: üìÑ Reload Document
reload_document_button.description: Reload the current document from its original source. Useful if the source file has been updated.
tips: Works for local files, YouTube, and web pages
Clears any cached content
Conversation thread is preserved

export_document_button.title: üìù Export As...
export_document_button.description: Save the current document content to a file. Choose from multiple formats including Word, PDF, and plain text.
tips: Available formats: .txt, .docx, .rtf, .pdf
Includes document metadata in exports
PDF export requires reportlab library

preview_area.title: üìÑ Preview
preview_area.description:
Shows a preview of the loaded document or the latest AI response to a prompt you have run.

 Click 'Full Text' to view the full contents of the Preview screen.

full_text_button.title: üîç Full Text
full_text_button.description:
Opens the document in a new window.

Text that has been produced in response to an AI prompt that you have run can be edited in the Full Text window when they are loaded from the Documents Library. They are labelled [Response] in the Documents Library.

Source documents (that is, those which are loaded but which haven't been produced in response to an AI prompt) are read-only.

prompt_dropdown.title: üìã Prompt Selector
prompt_dropdown.description:
Displays the name of a prompt stored in the Prompts Library. Saves retyping frequently used prompts.

The full text of the prompt appears in the box below.

Prompts can be added, edited or deleted in the Prompts Library. To access the Prompts Library, press the 'Prompts Library' button.

prompt_text.title: ‚úèÔ∏è Prompt Text
prompt_text.description:
This is the instruction you send to the AI along with the text(s) that you have loaded and/or attached. The AI sees both the prompt and the loaded/attached text(s).

You can edit prompts drawn from the Prompts Library here. But go to the Prompts Library if you want to save your edits.

You can write any prompt you wish here - you're not limited to prompts stored in the Prompts Library.The only purpose of the Prompts Library is to save time and keystrokes by allowing re-use of frequently-used prompts.

Be specific about what you are asking the AI to do.

run_prompt_button.title: ‚ñ∂ Run Prompt
run_prompt_button.description:
Send your prompt and the text(s) to which it relates  to the selected AI model for processing.

The AI response is saved automatically to the Documents Library and appears in the Preview box below when it has been completed.

The AI response can be viewed in full by pressing the 'Full Text' button.

run_prompt_dropdown.title: ‚ñº Run Options
run_prompt_dropdown.description:
There are three options for running your prompt:

‚ñ∂ Via DocAnalyser - Send to the selected cloud AI provider while staying within DocAnalyser.

üåê Via Web - Run the prompt on the AI provider's website. The prompt and the text(s) it relates to are copied automatically to the clipboard. The selected cloud AI provider's website is opened automatically. You paste the clipboard contents into the AI provider's web interface and run the prompt. Optionally, 'Capture Response' can be used when the prompt response is complete to save it to the Documents Library, from where it will be accessible by selecting 'View Thread or 'Full Text'.

üíª Via Local AI - Run the prompt on your own computer. Requires LM Studio to be installed and running, with a local AI model loaded.

Using 'Via DocAnalyser' enables prompts to be run and stored with one click. Users need to obtain an API key from the AI provider in order to use it. It usually incurs some (small) costs. Press the 'AI Costs' button for further information.

'Via Local AI' is slower than the other options. It is free. It is a good option when privacy is a primary concern.

'Via Web' is free, fast and does not require an API key. While not difficult to use, it requires a few more clicks than the 'Via DocAnalyser' option.

followup_button.title: üí¨ Follow-up
followup_button.description:
Ask follow-up question(s). Responses are saved in a 'conversation thread'. You can pick up and continue conversations in future sessions.

Conversation threads can be viewed via the 'View Thread' button.

You can switch AI models mid-conversation if needed.

web_response_capture.title: üìã Capture Web Response
web_response_capture.description:
After using 'Via Web', a blue banner appears at the bottom of the window. This allows you to capture the AI's response and save it to the Documents Library.

Workflow:
1. Run prompt via 'Via Web' (copies to clipboard, opens browser)
2. Paste into AI chat and get response
3. Copy the AI's response
4. Click 'Capture Response' in DocAnalyser
5. Response is saved to Documents Library

This lets you get the speed and free access of web chat while still building a searchable library of AI responses.
tips: The captured response includes the original prompt for context
Click 'Dismiss' if you don't need to save the response
Captured responses can be loaded and used for follow-up questions

view_thread_button.title: üí¨ View Thread
view_thread_button.description: Open a window showing your conversation history with the AI about the submitted text(s), including all prompts and responses.

start_fresh_button.title: üîÑ Start Fresh
start_fresh_button.description: Clear the current conversation thread so that you can start a new dialogue. The text(s) is/are preserved and remain(s) loaded but the AI will have no memory of prior exchanges.

history_button.title: üìú History
history_button.description: Show the AI processing history for all texts in the current session.

prompts_library_button.title: üìã Prompts Library

lm_studio_setup.title: üñ•Ô∏è Running AI Locally with LM Studio
lm_studio_setup.description: LM Studio lets you run AI models on your own computer - completely free and private. Your documents never leave your machine. This is ideal for users who want privacy, have no internet, or prefer not to pay for cloud AI.
tips: **What You Need**: A PC with at least 16GB of RAM (32GB recommended for larger models). A dedicated graphics card (GPU) helps but isn't essential.
**Step 1 - Download LM Studio**: Visit lmstudio.ai and download the free application for Windows, Mac, or Linux. Install it like any other program.

**Step 2 - Download a Model**: Open LM Studio, go to the 'Discover' tab, and search for a model. For simple summaries, we recommend: Phi-3-mini (3.8B) - fast and efficient, Llama 3.2 3B - good all-rounder, or Mistral 7B - higher quality but slower.
**Step 3 - Load the Model**: Go to the 'Local Server' tab (left sidebar), select your downloaded model, and click 'Start Server'. Wait until it says 'Server running'.

**Step 4 - Connect DocAnalyser**: In DocAnalyser, go to Settings, select 'LM Studio (Local)' as your provider, and click 'Test Connection'. If it works, your local models will appear in the model dropdown.
**Choosing a Model Size**: Smaller models (3B parameters) are faster but less nuanced. Larger models (7B-13B) give better quality but are slower. For basic summaries, 3B models work very well.
**Chunk Size Tip**: When using local models, go to Settings > Chunk Settings and select 'Tiny' or 'Small'. This prevents overloading the model with too much text at once.

**Speed Expectations**: Local AI is slower than cloud APIs. A 500-word summary might take 15-45 seconds with a 3B model, compared to 5-10 seconds with a cloud API. The trade-off is complete privacy and zero cost.

local_model_recommendations.title: üìä Recommended Local Models
local_model_recommendations.description: If you're new to local AI, here are the best models to start with based on your computer's capabilities and what you want to do.
tips: **For 16GB RAM - Basic Summaries**: Phi-3-mini-4k-instruct (3.8B) - Microsoft's efficient model, great for summaries and Q&A. Very fast.
**For 16GB RAM - Better Quality**: Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct - Meta's latest small model. Good balance of speed and quality.
**For 32GB RAM - Higher Quality**: Mistral-7B-Instruct - Excellent quality, handles complex analysis well. Slower but worth it for important documents.
**For 32GB+ RAM - Best Quality**: Llama-3.1-8B-Instruct or Phi-4 (14B) - Near cloud-quality results, but requires patience.
**Avoid for Summarisation**: Models over 13B parameters unless you have 64GB+ RAM and a good GPU. They'll be frustratingly slow.
**Look for 'Instruct' or 'Chat' versions**: These are tuned to follow instructions. Base models without these labels won't work as well for document analysis.
**Quantised Models**: In LM Studio, you'll see options like Q4_K_M or Q8. Lower numbers (Q4) use less RAM but slightly lower quality. Q4_K_M is usually the sweet spot.
